intro: Euryops sparsiflorus, commonly known as the sparseflower dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, and it produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Euryops sparsiflorus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils.
